data.prayer: Father, remind your church in North Andros, Bahamas that you have set your Son over all rule and authority, power and dominion, and every name that is invoked.
data.verse: he raised Christ from the dead and seated him at his right hand in the heavenly realms, far above all rule and authority, power and dominion, and every name that is invoked, not only in the present age but also in the one to come.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of North Andros, Bahamas
data.section_summary: What beauty can God be thanked for in this photo?

data.prayer: Spirit, encourage every one of the 1,782 ordinary believers here to care for others, like a shepherd cares for his sheep.
Father, look after and teach the way that is best for the 1,782 believers living in North Andros, Bahamas.
data.verse: I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go. I will counsel you with my loving eye on you.

data.prayer: Lord, the the state of North Andros will disappear one day, but your Word will never disappear. Call all who claim Christianity to anchor their lives on your Word.
data.verse: Heaven and earth will disappear, but my words will never disappear.

data.focus_label: Pray for the city of Andros Town
data.prayer: Pray that God raises up new churches in the city of Andros Town, North Andros, Bahamas.
Jesus, make yourself known to the 4,500 people living in North Andros through the internet today.
data.verse: They have no speech, they use no words; no sound is heard from them. Yet their voice goes out into all the earth, their words to the ends of the world. In the heavens God has pitched a tent for the sun.

data.prayer: Lord, please make the same Spirit that raised Jesus from the dead give life to those who are called by his name in the state of North Andros.
data.verse: But if the Spirit of him who raised up Jesus from the dead dwells in you, he who raised up Christ Jesus from the dead will also give life to your mortal bodies through his Spirit who dwells in you.

data.prayer: Father, we pray the believers are good spiritual stewards of their everyday relationships in North Andros, Bahamas.
